intro: Randia lasiophylla, commonly known as the roughleaf randia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of the Americas. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 12,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, white or pale pink flowers and hairy, rough-textured leaves. It typically grows as an erect shrub, often reaching heights of up to 1 meter. Randia lasiophylla is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and along stream banks.
